addons.name: A339X
addons.description: The Airbus A330neo is a wide-body airliner developed by Airbus from the Airbus A330. The A330neo has 260 and 300 seats in a typical three-class layout, or up to 460 in economy class and has a range of 7,200 nautical miles. It is exclusively powered by the Rolls-Royce Trent 7000.

tracks.name: Release
tracks.description:
Stable is our variant that has the least bugs and best performance. This version will not always be up to date but we guarantee its compatibility with each major patch from MSFS.

**SimBrief Airframes for Stable**

Airframe for: [A330-900](https://dispatch.simbrief.com/airframes/share/352855_1683790837790)

Airframe for: [ACJ330-900](https://dispatch.simbrief.com/airframes/share/352855_1683790837791)

tracks.name: Pre-Release
tracks.description:
This is a pre-release version of our Addon used for public testing before the official launch. You can choose between the stable build, which is the final version, or the prerelease build, which may have some bugs or incomplete features but is useful for testing and providing feedback to our developers.

**SimBrief Airframes for Pre-Release**

Airframe for: [A330-900](https://dispatch.simbrief.com/airframes/share/352855_1683790837790)

Airframe for: [ACJ330-900](https://dispatch.simbrief.com/airframes/share/352855_1683790837791)

dependencies.modalText: SimBridge allows the A339X to expose remote tools like the Web MCDU, as well as use the external terrain database.

incompatibleAddons.title: Toolbar Pushback
incompatibleAddons.creator: AmbitiousPilots
incompatibleAddons.description: This add-on sometimes causes performance issues and also sometimes prevents the A339X from taxiing. Consider removing it if you experience these issues.

incompatibleAddons.title: z-Newlight-settinglight-headwind-a330neo
incompatibleAddons.creator: Nicottine
incompatibleAddons.description: Before installing and utilizing the A339X, it is imperative to remove this add-on. This particular add-on overrides crucial light components, thereby disabling the functionality of cockpit lights and rendering the model inoperable.

incompatibleAddons.title: Headwind A339X Weather Radar Mod
incompatibleAddons.description: It is required to remove this add-on before installing and using the A339X. This add-on overrides A339X components may render the A339X unusable.

addons.name: A333X
addons.description: The Airbus A333-300 is a wide-body airliner that is part of the A330 family of commercial jets. It is a variant of the A330neo (new engine option) series, which also includes the larger A330-900. The A330-800 is designed to be a more fuel-efficient and cost-effective alternative to the older A330-200 model.

tracks.name: Development
tracks.description:
The most recent features that make it into the next stable will be in development. Bugs should be anticipated. It is updated each time a new commit is added to GitHub's "main" branch. 

**Please be aware that no support will be offered via Discord support channels.**

addons.name: SU95X
addons.description: Sukhoi Superjet 100 is a regional jet designed by Sukhoi Civil Aircraft. It replaces Tupolev Tu-134 and Yakovlev Yak-42, as well as competes with Embraer E190 and Bombardier CRJ1000. It is the first Russian airliners designed after the fall of the Soviet Union. It uses PowerJet (Joint Venture between Safran and Russias NPO Saturn) SaM 146 to power the aircraft. While it receives some international orders, SSJ100 has trouble gaining popularity outside Russia due to spare parts issues.

tracks.name: Release
tracks.description: Stable is our variant that is based on the FlyByWire A32NX stable version and has the fewest issues and best performance. This version won't always up-to-date, but we promise that it will work with all of MSFS's significant updates.

tracks.name: Pre-Release
tracks.description: This is a pre-release version of our Addon used for public testing before the official launch. You can choose between the stable build, which is the final version, or the prerelease build, which may have some bugs or incomplete features but is useful for testing and providing feedback to our developers.

addons.name: A339X Livery Package
addons.description: This package includes liveries for AirBelgium, Condor (Beach, Island, and Sea variants), Corsair, Delta, Hifly, and TAP (Air Portugal and STAR Alliance variants), all carefully designed to match the real-life paint schemes of these airlines. Whether you're looking to simulate a transatlantic flight with Delta, a tropical getaway with Corsair, or a business trip with TAP, our liveries will help you fully immerse in your simulation experience.

addons.name: SimBridge
addons.description: SimBridge is an external application which allows FBW aircraft to communicate with components located outside the simulator. SimBridge will be used for a number of features requiring external data (such as TAWS terrain display), as well as for functionality providing remote access to aircraft systems or data.

tracks.name: Release
tracks.description: SimBridge is an external app that enables FlyByWire Simulations aircraft to communicate outside your simulator. From remote displays to external terrain display rendering, it is used for a variety of optional features.

addons.name: A318ceo
addons.description: The Airbus A318ceo is a narrow-body airliner developed by Airbus as part of the Airbus A320 family. The A318ceo can accommodate around 107 to 132 passengers in a typical two-class layout, or more if configured exclusively in an economy class layout. It has a range of approximately 3,100 nautical miles. It can be powered by either the CFM56-5B or Pratt & Whitney PW6000 engines.

tracks.name: Release
tracks.description:
The Airbus A318ceo is a narrow-body airliner developed by Airbus as part of the Airbus A320 family. The A318ceo can accommodate around 107 to 132 passengers in a typical two-class layout, or more if configured exclusively in an economy class layout. It has a range of approximately 3,100 nautical miles. It can be powered by either the CFM56-5B or Pratt & Whitney PW6000 engines.

**Please be aware that you will need the LatinVFR Airbus A318ceo Addon to use this.**

dependencies.modalText: SimBridge allows the A318X to expose remote tools like the Web MCDU, as well as use the external terrain database.

To install the Horizon Simulations A318ceo package, you MUST have the LatinVFR Airbus A318ceo installed. This Horizon Simulations add-on will NOT work standalone and is dependent on the core assets and modules provided by the LatinVFR package. Ensure you have a legitimate and fully functional copy of the LatinVFR Airbus A318ceo before proceeding with the installation to avoid any issues or conflicts.

To install the Horizon Simulations A318ceo package, you MUST have the Asobo Airbus A320neo installed. This Horizon Simulations add-on will NOT work standalone and is dependent on the core assets and modules provided by the Asobo package. Ensure you have a legitimate and fully functional copy of the Asobo Airbus A320neo before proceeding with the installation to avoid any issues or conflicts.

addons.name: A319ceo
addons.description: The Airbus A319ceo is a narrow-body airliner developed by Airbus as part of the Airbus A320 family. The A319ceo typically seats 124 to 156 passengers in a two-class layout, or more when configured exclusively in an economy class layout. It has a range of around 3,700 nautical miles. It can be powered by either the CFM56-5B or IAE V2500 engines.

addons.name: A320ceo
addons.description: The Airbus A320ceo is a narrow-body airliner developed by Airbus as the flagship model of the Airbus A320 family. The A320ceo typically seats 150 to 180 passengers in a two-class layout, or more when configured exclusively in an economy class layout. It has a range of approximately 3,300 nautical miles. It can be powered by either the CFM56-5B or IAE V2500 engines.

addons.name: A321neo
addons.description: The Airbus A321neo is a narrow-body airliner developed by Airbus as an evolution of the Airbus A321 member of the A320 family. The A321neo typically seats between 185 to 240 passengers in a two-class layout, or more when configured exclusively in an economy class layout. It has a range of up to 4,000 nautical miles, depending on specific configurations and cabin layouts. The A321neo is powered by a choice of either the Pratt & Whitney PW1100G-JM or the CFM International LEAP-1A engines.

tracks.name: Release

addons.name: B789
addons.description: The Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner is a wide-body twin-engine jet airliner developed by Boeing as part of the 787 Dreamliner family. The 787-9 typically accommodates between 290 to 296 passengers in a three-class configuration, with the capacity to carry up to around 406 passengers in a two-class configuration. It boasts a range of approximately 7,530 nautical miles. The 787-9 is exclusively powered by a choice of two engines: either the Rolls-Royce Trent 1000 or the General Electric GEnx-1B.

tracks.name: Release
tracks.description:
The Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner is a wide-body twin-engine jet airliner developed by Boeing as part of the 787 Dreamliner family. The 787-9 typically accommodates between 290 to 296 passengers in a three-class configuration, with the capacity to carry up to around 406 passengers in a two-class configuration. It boasts a range of approximately 7,530 nautical miles. The 787-9 is exclusively powered by a choice of two engines: either the Rolls-Royce Trent 1000 or the General Electric GEnx-1B.

**Please be aware that you will need the Asobo Boeing 787 Dreamliner Addon to use this.**

dependencies.modalText: To install the Horizon Simulations Boeing 787-9 Add-On, you MUST have the Asobo Studio 787-10 Dreamliner (Included in MSFS Premium Deluxe) installed. This Horizon Simulations add-on will NOT work standalone and is dependent on the core assets and modules provided by the Asobo Studios package. Ensure you have a legitimate and fully functional copy of the Asobo Studio 787-10 Dreamliner before proceeding with the installation to avoid any issues or conflicts.

addons.name: B78X
addons.description: The Boeing 787-10 Dreamliner is the largest variant of the 787 Dreamliner family developed by Boeing. The 787-10 typically seats between 330 to 340 passengers in a three-class configuration, with the capacity to carry more if configured in denser layouts. It has a range of approximately 6,430 nautical miles. Like its siblings in the 787 family, the 787-10 is exclusively powered by a choice of two engines: either the Rolls-Royce Trent 1000 or the General Electric GEnx-1B.

Ensure you have a legitimate and fully functional copy of the Asobo Studio 787-10 Dreamliner before proceeding with the installation to avoid any issues or conflicts.

addons.name: 787 Cockpit Textures
addons.description: Experience enhanced realism in Microsoft Flight Simulator with the cockpit texture pack created by Mike, known as morerightrudder. This exclusive add-on, available only through the Headwind Simulations Installer, features meticulously crafted textures for the B788, B789/B78X cockpits. Compatible with Kuro 787-8, Horizon Simulations B787-9 and B787-10, as well as MSFS Premium Deluxe B787-10, this pack elevates your aviation simulation by offering unparalleled detail and immersion.

tracks.name: Release
tracks.description: Experience enhanced realism in Microsoft Flight Simulator with the cockpit texture pack created by Mike, known as morerightrudder. addons.name: Boeing 787-9 Livery Package
addons.description: The Horizon Simulations Boeing 787-9 official livery package includes a diverse range of airline designs created by various artists. The package features liveries from major airlines like Air Canada, Air China, Air France, American Airlines, British Airways, and more, with each livery credited to its respective artist. Notable liveries include special editions like Air Canada's "Fly The Flag," Air New Zealand's black color scheme, ANA's "Star Wars" theme, and EL AL's Jerusalem Of Gold. This collection offers a wide variety of designs, showcasing the global appeal and versatility of the Boeing 787-9 aircraft.
